fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22875].
  {panel}

By default, web sudo and other password confirmation features in Confluence 3.5 and later are disabled if a custom authenticator is detected. However, there is an override flag that was added as part of CONF-20958 that allows administrators to turn it on again.

If it is turned on manually, in most cases it won't work properly. When user is required to confirm the password, Confluence always checks the entered password against the internally stored user/password. If an instance is configured to use custom authentication which is different from atlassian-user, the password validation will fail.

*Technical notes*

The reason behind this is that there is no public {{authenticate(String username, String password)}} method in [Seraph's Authenticator interface|http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-seraph/0.38/apidocs/com/atlassian/seraph/auth/Authenticator.html] that can be used to determine whether a user's password is valid, so Confluence just looks at its internal user management system.

We could potentially use [Authenticator.login()|http://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-seraph/0.38/apidocs/com/atlassian/seraph/auth/Authenticator.html#login%28javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest,%20javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse,%20java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String%29], but that has a number of side-effects in the Confluence code, including logging out the user if the web sudo authentication fails. That would not be desirable.

Given the difficulty of changing Seraph's primary interface and updating all the implementations, this is unlikely to be an easy issue to resolve.
fields.summary: Support web sudo and other password confirmation features with custom authenticators

fields.description:
After upgrading to Confluence 3.5, our nested groups are no longer working even though the check mark is ticked.

I suspect that the "Additional Group DN:" it imported might be limiting the scope. We have confluence groups specifically set up under ou=confluence,ou=applications,DC=uwo,DC=ca but those groups can contain other groups which are under OU=Administration,DC=uwo,DC=ca . The groups under ou=confluence seem to pull up fine but the sub-groups do not.

If I try to remove the Additional Group DN so confluence would search for groups broadly under DC=uwo,DC=ca, after I hit save and go back in to edit the config to make sure it works, the ou=confluence,ou=applications re-appears.

As a result, many of our users are not able to access the spaces they need to.
fields.summary: Nested groups are not working after upgrade to 3.5

fields.description:
Currently Confluence users are unable to use the #include Velocity function to include files into the rendered html via the Administrator site layouts area.  My use case is I have a standard header across multiple products (Confluence, Jira, Fisheye/Crucible, IP.Board), and I want to directly include it from a file shared across all products, so if I change that one file it will update everywhere. The workaround was to use #parse, but parse interprets statements in the file as Velocity code, which is problematic if your html/javascript contains statements that are similar to Velocity.

I've attached a patch that fixes this from Confluence 3.5.1-3.5.7(current), the problem is twofold:
1- There is no included file resource loader in Velocity's config, an easy addition to the properties file
2- There is a bug in the Hibernate resource loader that returns null instead of ResourceNotFoundException when it cannot find a resource in the database, preventing Velocity from falling through to the next resource loader.  Easy and tested fix.
fields.summary: [PATCH included] Unable to use Velocity include function from site layouts

fields.description:
Either "Mail Page" or "Share" feature can work properly at a time.

The issue started from 3.5 where "Share" feature was introduced and it affect fresh and upgrade instances.

Scenario 1 (Fresh Installation)
# Install fresh 3.5.1
# Install Mail Page Plugin v1.12 & configure mail server
# Mailing a page in HTML format will work as normal but sharing a page will not. The shared page will be sent to mailbox but the title & content weren't visible and the formatting seems like as if it was from mailing a page (case 1.jpg)
# To make "Share" feature to work, disable and enable again Mail Page Plugin or Share Plugin
# Sharing a page will then work but mailing a page in HTML format will not work. Send & Cancel buttons were not visible and the formatting seems to originates from Share function (case 2.jpg)
# You will need to disable and enable again Mail Page Plugin or Share Plugin to have it work  

Scenario 2 (Upgrade Instance)
# Upgrade 3.4.9 (already installed with Mail Page Plugin v1.12) to 3.5.4
# Mailing a page in HTML format will work as normal but sharing a page will not. The shared page will be sent to mailbox but the title & content weren't visible and the formatting seems like as if it was from mailing a page (case 1.jpg)
# To make "Share" feature to work, disable and enable again Mail Page Plugin or Share Plugin
# Sharing a page will then work but mailing a page in HTML format will not work. Send & Cancel buttons were not visible and the formatting seems to originates from Share function (case 2.jpg)
# You will need to disable and enable again Mail Page Plugin or Share Plugin to have it work  
 
However, mailing a page in Text format will work as normal except that the sender will always appear as Anonymous (case 0.jpg)
fields.summary: Clashing of features between Mail Page Plugin & Share Plugin

fields.description:
1) We have created custom dashboards having multiple KPIs .
One of the KPI is based on the query as mentioned below :

project = GPROJECTS AND reporter = "user@apple.com" AND status != Closed AND issuetype in (Project) AND cf[10053]="cf1" ORDER BY summary ASC, key DESC

2) We have created another KPI having exactly the same query but for the cf[10053] value . (Query below

project = GPROJECTS AND reporter = "user@apple.com" AND status != Closed AND issuetype in (Project) AND cf[10053]="cf12" ORDER BY summary ASC, key DESC

Would it be possible to parameterize the values for cf[10053] . That is , we pass the value for cf[10053] at runtime by selecting values from, say, a dropdown ?
We would want to use a single query and pass different values to cf[10053] at runtime

fields.description:
h3. Description
This issue seems to affect all Confluence 3.5 and above (New code macro plugin is implemented). Users upgrading from Confluence prior to 3.5 with code macro parameters that have a mixture of uppercase letters will encounter the following error:

{quote}
code: Invalid value specified for parameter lang
{quote}

h3. How to Reproduce

# Create a page in Confluence 3.5
# Key in \{code: None\} example \{code\} under Wiki Markup
!codemacro.jpg!
# Save the page
# You will see the following error message displayed:
!codemacro2.jpg!
# Try to edit the page again, if you go over to the Wiki Markup tab, notice that the contents inside the code macro is missing:
!codemacro3.jpg!


h3. Workaround
h4. Option 1) Disabling the New Code Macro and install the older Code Macro 
# Go to Confluence Admin >> Plugins >> Code Macro Plugin >> Disable Code Macro Plugin 
# Download the attached confluence-code-macro-1.5.jar (Old code macro)
# Install this plugin via Confluence Admin >> Plugins >> Install >> Upload Plugin

h4. Option 2) Database search and replace
The following query works on MySQL:

{code} UPDATE `bodycontent` set body = replace(body, '{code:None}', '{code:none}') {code}

After performing the query, go to Confluence Admin >> Cache Statistics >> Click on Flush All. The problem should be fixed now.
fields.summary: Code Macro's parameter case sensitivity is causing issues.

fields.description:
The method Confluence is currently using for connecting to the database during bootstrap checks only works for C3P0 based connection settings. These settings are only set for direct JDBC connections, and are not available for JNDI datasource connections. Confluence needs to verify the connection settings by using whatever ConnectionProvider is appropriate (e.g. as determined by Hibernate's ConnectionProviderFactory), rather than just choosing one at random.

By failing to open connections in with the correct provider, Confluence will refuse to start for any customer using MySQL via a JNDI datasource, making this a blocker for any affected customer.
fields.summary: MySQL isolation level check does not work for JNDI datasources

Whenever we want to share one new important page, we are using the "share" functionality which is a great feature in confluence. But we are always running into a pretty cumbersome exercise when wanting to inform ALL our users about a new page, as you can only enter one user after the other, which is more or less impossible if you have more then 100 users. In this case we are not using the "share" functionality, but are using "normal" E-Mails containing a link of the page.

Therefore it would be great feature if you can also select groups within the "share" functionality. With that new feature it would be a straight forward activity to inform all users about a new page.

thanks,
Christian

fields.description:
The following is part of the default Page Layout in Confluence:

{code}
#applyDecorator("root")
    #decoratorParam("sitemeshPage" $sitemeshPage)
    #decoratorParam("page" $page)
    #decoratorParam("context" "comments")
#end
{code}

If "#decoratorParam("context" "comments")" is taken out by editing the layout, accessing a page affected by this will cause Confluence to run out of memory. This can happen even if the custom layout is applied at a space level, meaning space admins can take down Confluence accidentally.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22779].
  {panel}

Currently, search weighting is not user-configurable.

This is a request to give users control over the search weighting via the web interface.

h3. Workaround (Only applicable to Confluence 3.5.13 until 5.1.x)

* Extract the indexingSubsystemContext.xml file from the confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-X.X.X.jar
* Place the indexingSubsystemContext.xml file in your confluence/WEB-INF/classes directory
* Edit the indexingSubsystemContext.xml file's contentBoostPostProcessor section, adjusting the weighting as required.
* Restart Confluence and issue a full reindex of content to update the weighting in the index.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of Lucene search result weighting

fields.description:
If you are using the Documentation theme, and have a custom footer that is taller than the default footer, the footer will overlap certain Save buttons in the interface.

For example, if commenting on a blog post, the "Post" and "Cancel" buttons will be hidden. 

In the Space Admin->Theme->Configure Theme, the "Confirm" and "Cancel" buttons will be hidden. 

I've attached our footer-content.vm file to show the extra line that was added. We had added custom CSS to our global stylesheet for the copyright notice, to make its appearance more like the other text in the footer, but as you can see, this custom CSS did not transfer over to the documentation theme anyway, so I have not included it. (I believe this is default behavior.) However, even adding our custom CSS inline did not fix the problem; only shrinking the height of the footer fixed it.

See attached screenshots for pictures of the issue. The screenshots were taken on our development instance, since we already corrected the issue on our live instance and didn't want to revert. (We fixed the problem by moving our copyright notice to the same line as the other notices, thereby shrinking the footer.)
fields.summary: Tall footer hides save buttons in Documentation Theme
Add Comments when Viewing Attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22768].
  {panel}

It would be great if one could convert an already uploaded Word Doc attachment into a Confluence page. I can think of a couple possible ways:

1) when viewing attachments, add an item next to certain Document attachments (along with Properties, Remove, Edit in Office, View) that says "Convert to Page" or just "Convert" then use the "doc import" engine to convert the already existing attachment to a confluence page, so that one doesn't have to re-upload, or download and then re-upload the document. User would then be asked if it should be a child page or a sibling page to the current one. 

2) in the Import Word Document area,  instead of just a "browse" button for uploading, have an "import from attachments" icon that pulls up the page location box, so one can search, go to recently viewed, or browse to the attachment, select it, and then choose to make it a child or sibling of the current page.

This way, if someone has already uploaded a bunch of docs, but really wants people to comment on them, or especially edit them but within confluence, they can easily be converted to confluence pages.
fields.summary: Import or Convert Doc Attachment to Page
Bug in DefaultI18n bean escaping

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22763].
  {panel}

CONF-4289 asked that comments for pages be appended to the searchable text of each page.  I suggest that this behavior either be removed or significantly improved.  It's confusing to our users when searching to have seemingly unrelated text abruptly appended to each search result.  It's even more confusing when the comment text does not include any relevant keywords for the search.

I do not have any suggestions for how to make this look better as I'm not aware of the abilities and limitations of Confluence's search library, and I'm also not a UI designer.  But if possible do as many of the following as possible:

1. Make it clear that the comment text is comment text.  Use colors, line breaks, delimiters, hover-text, etc.
2. Only show comment text if the content of the comment is relevant to the search
fields.summary: Distinguish version comment content from page content when showing it in search results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22761].
  {panel}

Use Cases, as they're described by Alistair Cockburn, relies heavily on numbered lists and requires some features, that currently not supported by Confluence:
* Specifying offset for numbering (e.g. start list from "2." for offset 2)
* Specifying arbitrary prefix for an item (e.g. "2-6a.", "2-6b." with prefix "2-6")
* Defining format of the numbered list for specific level (whether it'll be "1.2.3. or  "1.a.i.")

I've attached a file with one of the classical examples of Use Case in Fully Dressed format to give you an impression on what's supposed to be possible to achieve.
fields.summary: Extend numbered lists supports in Confluence to accomodate Use Case definition

fields.description:
All changes within a Wiki should be transparent to changes - also what a admin does! Why is the admin-backend excluded from this important concept? IMHO all admin-settings should be subject to versioning making it easy to trace and proof date and time of changes and get back settings changed falsely.

This concept would also allow admins to enable users to change more settings within thier spaces in a much more open way - without defining special rights.
fields.summary: Versioning in Admin Backend
